vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 273
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 273; To save at least $5 billion by consolidating some duplicative and overlapping government programs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 286
vote.title: Inouye Amdt. No. 286; To provide for the Director of the Office of Management and Budget to submit recommended rescissions in accordance with the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974 for Government programs and agencies with duplicative and overlapping missions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 281
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 281; To save at least $20 million annually by ending federal unemployment payments to jobless millionaires and billionaires.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 183
vote.title: McConnell Amdt. No. 183; To prohibit the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency from promulgating any regulation concerning, taking action relating to, or taking into consideration the emission of a greenhouse gas to address climate change.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 215
vote.title: Rockefeller Amdt. No. 215; To suspend, until the end of the 2-year period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act, any Environmental Protection Agency action under the Clean Air Act with respect to carbon dioxide or methane pursuant to certain proceedings, other than with respect to motor vehicle emissions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 277
vote.title: Stabenow Amdt. No. 277; To suspend, for 2 years, any Environmental Protection Agency enforcement of greenhouse gas regulations, to exempt American agriculture from greenhouse gas regulations, and to increase the number of companies eligible to participate in the successful Advanced Energy Manufacturing Tax Credit Program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 236
vote.title: Baucus Amdt. No. 236; To prohibit the regulation of greenhouse gases from certain sources.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table
vote.title: Motion to Table Paul Motion to Commit S. 493, to Committee on Foreign Relations, with Instructions; A bill to reauthorize and improve the SBIR and STTR programs, and for other purposes.

vote.title: H.R. 4; A bill to repeal the expansion of information reporting requirements for payments of $600 or more to corporations, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 284
vote.title: Menendez Amdt. No. 284; To protect small businesses from health insurance premium increases or losses of health insurance coverage.

vote.title: Snowe Amdt. No. 193; To strike the Federal authorization of the National Veterans Business Development Corporation.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S. 223 As Amended; A bill to modernize the air traffic control system, improve the safety, reliability, and availability of transportation by air in the United States, provide modernization of the air traffic control system, reauthorize the Federal Aviation Administration, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 91
vote.title: Motion to Table Coburn Amdt. No. 91; To decrease the Federal share of project costs under the airport improvement program for non-primary airports.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 80
vote.title: Motion to Table Coburn Amdt. No. 80 As Modified; To limit essential air service to locations that are 100 or more miles away from the nearest medium or large hub airport.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 18
vote.title: Motion to Table Paul Amdt. No. 18; To strike the provisions relating to clarifying a memorandum of understanding between the Federal Aviation Administration and the Occupational Safety and Health Administration.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 4
vote.title: Motion to Table McCain Amdt. No. 4; To repeal the essential air service program.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 514 As Amended; A bill to extend expiring provisions of the USA PATRIOT Improvement and Reauthorization Act of 2005 and Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004 relating to access to business records, individual terrorists as agents of foreign powers, and roving wiretaps until December 8, 2011.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 21
vote.title: Motion to Table Paul Amdt. No. 21; To reduce the total amount authorized to be appropriated for the Federal Aviation Administration for fiscal year 2011 to the total amount authorized to be appropriated for the Administration for fiscal year 2008.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 14
vote.title: Wicker Amdt. No. 14 As Modified; To exclude employees of the Transportation Security Administration from the collective bargaining rights of Federal employees and provide employment rights and an employee engagement mechanism for passenger and property screeners.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 58
vote.title: Nelson (NE) Amdt. No. 58 As Amended; To impose a criminal penalty for unauthorized recording or distribution of images produced using advanced imaging technology during screenings of individuals at airports and upon entry to Federal buildings.

vote.title: S. Res. 21 As Amended; A resolution to amend the Standing Rules of the Senate to provide procedures for extended debate.

vote.title: S. Res. 10 As Amended; A resolution to improve the debate and consideration of legislative matters and nominations in the Senate.

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S. Res. 8; A resolution amending the Standing Rules of the Senate to provide for cloture to be invoked with less than a three-fifths majority after additional debate.

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S. Res. 29; A resolution to permit the waiving of the reading of an amendment if the text and adequate notice are provided.

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S. Res. 28; A resolution to establish as a standing order of the Senate that a Senator publicly disclose a notice of intent to objecting to any measure or matter.
